item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 5:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (211 points | 50 comments)
2. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (146 points | 33 comments)
3. Delta: A syntax-highlighting pager for Git, diff, grep, and blame output (510 points | 68 comments)
4. Texture-Less Text Rendering (110 points | 36 comments)
5. Mitochondria Are Alive (569 points | 360 comments)
6. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
7. Following Wyoming Example, Feds Limit Foreign Crypto Mines Near Military Bases (13 points | 1 comment)
8. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (109 points | 29 comments)
9. Memories are not only in the brain, human cell study finds (82 points | 29 comments)
10. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (18 points | 4 comments)
11. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (96 points | 53 comments)
12. Defending the Tor network: Mitigating IP spoofing against Tor (10 points | discuss)
13. In Memory of Stiver (431 points | 55 comments)
14. Notes on Guyana (63 points | 51 comments)
15. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (238 points | 100 comments)
16. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (108 points | 53 comments)
17. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (167 points | 54 comments)
18. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (138 points | 8 comments)
19. Using Two ReMarkables (37 points | 7 comments)
20. Gravity's Eastern Voyage (26 points | 3 comments)
21. A brief history of privacy protection on Macs (5 points | discuss)
22. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (62 points | 10 comments)
23. A CC-By Open-Source TTS Model with Voice Cloning (96 points | 17 comments)
24. Segmenting Credit Card Customers with K-Means: A Fun Dive into Clustering (36 points | 19 comments)
25. Writing Tiny Desktop Apps in C and GTK3 (2022) (34 points | 5 comments)
26. Lynis – Security auditing and hardening tool, for Unix-based systems (28 points | 6 comments)
27. Iterative α-(de)blending and Stochastic Interpolants (11 points | 1 comment)
28. Money was never the end goal – mrdoob – threejs creator (90 points | 25 comments)
29. SQLite is not a single connection database (21 points | 6 comments)
30. Algol-68 seemed like a good idea (57 points | 48 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 5:10 PM UTC
